meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of judgment.
meanings.sent1: Her judgmatical skills helped her make wise decisions.
meanings.sent2: The judgmatical approach to the problem led to a fair solution.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat showed a judgmatical attitude when choosing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The judgmatical nature of the old tree made it a reliable source of shade.
meanings.sent5: The judgmatical behavior of the teacher set a good example for the students.

meanings.sent1: He made a judgmatical choice by selecting the most suitable candidate.
meanings.sent2: The judgmatical decision to wait for more information proved to be wise.
meanings.sent3: The judgmatical squirrel carefully selected the ripest acorn to store for winter.
meanings.sent4: Her judgmatical eyes could spot a good deal from afar.
meanings.sent5: The judgmatical advice from the wise owl guided the young birds in their journey.
